Synopsis:- Jagachya Pathivar (1960) Marathi
A chance to visit the boy, whom he had saved from drowning. turns into a nightmare. As, on the run for being mistaken for a thief, this nameless destitute, who tries to hide in a crowd of protestors is soon hailed as their leader and is jailed. He is most happy as he is given food, work and finds people to talk to. But alas, all pleasures in life are short lived, his jail term has ended and he is back on the streets again. One day he befriends a blind girl, who works for a goon called Dada. Along with the blind girl, he starts living in Dada's house and is now  called Sakharam. He starts teaching the blind girl music. One day as they are singing, the blind girls parents show up and recognize her as their missing daughter and takes her away. Sakharam runs away but is soon located by Dada's henchmen. 
A poigant and touching human drama of self respect and human values, this thought provoking film is embellished with powerhouse performances and an unforgettable musical score.
